item.title: to Know True Peace
item.description:
Beyond the darkness,
Beyond the blue,
The heart of Dhamma,
Is so True.
True to kindness,
True to care,
Built on Lord Buddhas wisdom,
The power of his compassionate welfare.
Tis ardour in practice,
Gumption in peace,
Recollecting good action,
Ending mental disease.
... No names can then bind us,
... No signs can sway our hold,
Perfect in Sīla,
Perfect in Resolve.
No matter the barrier,
No matter the lair,
Mara will not hold us,
For the Well-Farer’s,
Teachings are close to bear.
Aligning in that goodness,
Waking up to inner strength,
Enduring patiently all contact,
The silent heart is best.
Whatever shackles bind us,
The Teacher taught all worldly flaws.
Overcoming our own weakness,
Recollect the Dhamma Ever-more.
Sati is the light force,
Sīla the inner guide,
Saddhā sparks that courageous endeavour,
& Paññā brings Mara’s demise.
No matter what the world says,
No matter how we feel,
The Teacher Taught us earnestness,
That it be imbued in the fabric of our weal.
From this brick & mortar,
From this blood & bones,
All lust and covetousness abandoned,
All anger and hatred without a home.
Greatness in peacefulness our station,
Greatness in fortitude our zeal,
From this skeleton of action,
The Kinsman of the Sun;
Shows us the Path that is Real.
Real to Right Intention,
Real to the 8 fold Path,
No matter the time of practice,
Ardour and splendour the Buddha's disciples art.
Persietence and patient endevour,
Building up the causes day and night,
Living up to our station of existence,
Disciples of the Tathāgata,
Blessed in practice's light.
Meditation on the loathsome,
Holding to each breath,
Death, decay at any moment,
Extinction of suffering Best.
So may we flow forward with the Dhamma,
The ocean, Nibbana's edge.
